title: Legislative Day 37 (part 2) - 2023 Session - 3/21/2023
summary:
# Georgia Legislative Day 37 (Part 2) - 2023 Session - 3/21/2023

## Overview
The Georgia Senate reconvened for the second part of Legislative Day 37, focusing on routine committee reports and procedural matters.

## Key Actions
None detected

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected

## Notable Moments
- The Senate Committee on Appropriations reported back several bills, including House Bill 611 and House Bill 19 (the general appropriations bill for the 2023-2024 fiscal year).
- The Senate adjourned until 1 PM on Thursday, March 23rd.

## Votes
None detected

## Attendance
Quorum was present to conduct business.

## Adjournment
The Senate adjourned at the conclusion of the day's proceedings until 1 PM on Thursday, March 23rd.

All right, the Senate will come back to order, the Secretary will read the reports of standing
committees.
Mr. President, the Senate Committee on Appropriations has had under consideration the following
legislation as the Secretary will report the same back to the Senate with the following
recommendation.
House Bill 611 do pass by substitute, House Bill 19 do pass by substitute, respectfully
submitted by Senator Tillery of the 19th District Chairman.
That completes the Order of Ms. President.
Thank you, Madam Secretary.
The Secretary will read bills and resolutions for the second time.
House Bill 19 by Representative Burns is a 159th and others general appropriations state fiscal year July 1st, 2023 to June 30th, 2024.
That completes the Order of Ms. President.
Thank you, Madam Secretary.
and pursuant to the previous order of the Senate,
the Senate stands adjourned until 1 p.m. Thursday, March 23rd.
Good job.
